page.title: 10HEAVY TRAFFIC IN ADLINGTON.
page.content: Considerable extra traffic flow was experienced in 1980 because of the stone aggregate carried from local quarries to complete the extension to the runway at Manchester Airport. This heavy vehicular traffic churned up the grass verges and severely deteriorated the surfaces of narrow country lanes The obsolete quarry in Long Lane is now used for maintenance and parking of heavy commercial vehicles, sadly continuing the misuse of our narrow country lanes and the amenity of established green-belt land.The road safety aspect regarding the children attending the primary school in Brookledge Lane has been discussed by the Parish Council, Borough Council, a nd the Director of Education with a view to providing a suitable car-park.
